meanings.sent1: Yesterday, a fun event transpired at the park.
meanings.sent2: The meeting will transpire in the conference room tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: It transpired that the cat had been hiding in the closet all along.
meanings.sent4: As the day transpired, the sun slowly set in the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The magic show transpired with colorful lights and surprises.

meanings.sent1: The truth finally transpired after years of secrecy.
meanings.sent2: Her secret plan will transpire once she starts implementing it.
meanings.sent3: It transpired that the missing keys were under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The mystery novel's plot twists slowly transpired to the readers.
meanings.sent5: The hidden treasure's location transpired in an old map.

meanings.definition: To give off or release (as in moisture)
meanings.sent1: The plants transpired water through their leaves.
meanings.sent2: The hot tea will transpire steam as it cools down.
meanings.sent3: It transpired that the leaky faucet was wasting a lot of water.
meanings.sent4: The wet clothes transpired moisture into the air as they dried.
meanings.sent5: The fresh bread transpired a tempting aroma in the kitchen.
